roleset.name: deal with, explain, give/tell report or explanation

role.descr: thing accounted for, dealt with, explained
instrumental, accounted for with or by

example.name: account-v: the bulk of the examples look just like this
example.text: Profit - taking accounted for much of the slide in OTC stock prices , according to David Mills , senior vice president of Boston Company Advisers .

propbank.arg: for much of the slide in OTC stock prices

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: At one point , Hammersmith is reported to have accounted for as much as 10 % of the sterling market in interest - rate swap dealings .

propbank.arg: for as much as 10 % of the sterling market

example.name: account-n: NP only, args 0 & 1
example.text: the Associated Press 's account of the Monday sequester order signed by President Bush

propbank.arg: of the Monday sequester order signed by President Bush

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: The intellectual understanding is there but it has n't yet been fully internalized , and this accounts for the gap that can often be seen between understanding and behavior .

propbank.arg: for the gap that can often be seen between understanding and behavior

example.name: account-n: All arguments, a little awkward, probably rare
example.text: Her account to Mirkheim of her taste in films and of the absurd horror screenplay she 's written is mercilessly funny .

propbank.arg: of her taste in films and of the absurd horror screenplay she 's written

example.name: accounting-n: accounting for
example.text: I guess there 's no accounting for taste .

example.name: accounting-n: accounting of
example.text: His accounting of the story took all night !

example.name: give_accounting-n: LVB, Arg 1 and modifier
example.text: He was unable to give a clear accounting for his actions .

roleset.note: ACCOUNT-V NOTES: No VN class. Comparison with handle. (from account.01-v)
ACCOUNT-N NOTES: Roleset based OntoNotes account-n grouping senses 2 & 3; no relevant PB verb entry; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from account.01-n)
ACCOUNTING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry account.01, OntoNotes grouping accounting-n sense 1; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from accounting.01-n)

role.descr: role or crime, accountable for what?

example.name: accountable-j: args 0, 1
example.text: She must be accountable for her war crimes .

example.name: accountable-j: args 0, 2
example.text: He is accountable to the committee .

roleset.name: managing finance

role.descr: account owner, if separate from arg0

example.name: accounting-n: arg1
example.text: Cost accounting is a process of collecting , analyzing , summarizing and evaluating various alternative courses of action .

example.name: accounting-n
example.text: Sullivan tried to defend his accounting for line costs ( as capital expenditure rather than profit - and - loss expense items ) .

propbank.arg: ( as capital expenditure rather than profit - and - loss expense items )

example.name: do_accounting-l: args 0, 2
example.text: He does accounting for transit companies .

roleset.note: ACCOUNTING-N NOTES: No VN class, FN class

roleset.name: consider

mapping.source: (A / take-01 :arg0 (n / NARG0) :arg1 (n2 / NARG1) :arg3 (X / thing :ARG1-of (C / accounting-03 :arg0 n)))

example.name: take_into_account-m
example.text: After taking into account the fallout from the China crisis , the government has projected 1989 GDP growth of 5 % .

propbank.arg: the fallout from the China crisis

roleset.note: TAKE_INTO_ACCOUNT-M NOTES: Added by Julia in conjunction with Tim in early MWE framing.
